metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10840 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Linux kernel is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in thefs/ext4/xattr.c:ext4_xattr_set_entry() function. An attacker could exploitthis by operating on a mounted crafted ext4 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10840` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1022.22~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1018.19~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-33.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.22~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1018.19~16.04.2').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
